page.title: 14HEALTH
page.content: Four thousand patients are on the Jarvis Brook & Rotherfield practice manned by two doctors who receive an average of Â£8 per patient annually. Travelling expenses etc. have to be paid from this.Doctors see about 40 patients daily, either in the surgery they own,or in homes which can involve journeys of up to six miles.The Health Visitor a qualified midwife, looks after pregnant women, 220 under 5's on the register and old age pensioners. She too,visits homes but is in the surgery between 9_10a.m. and 4.30_5p.m daily.She organises a baby clinic each Friday p.m.and visits Pembury and Kent & Sussex Hospitals each Wednesday and Thursday.A practice nurse is also emp_ loyed to deal with injections and common illnesses.An ambulance station with 2 ambulances, two drivers & two assistants serves the area.
